Package org.bluezoo.util

Class CompositeByteBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.util.CompositeByteBuffer
  • public class CompositeByteBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    A composite ByteBuffer that provides a unified view over two underlying ByteBuffers: an underflow buffer (for leftover bytes from previous processing) and a data buffer (for new incoming data). This avoids expensive copying operations when joining buffers.

    This class mimics the standard ByteBuffer API and is designed for use in streaming data processing scenarios where partial reads are common.

    Usage Pattern

    The typical workflow in a receive(ByteBuffer data) method is: 
     compositeBuffer.put(data);     // Add new data to composite view
 compositeBuffer.flip();         // Prepare for reading
 
 // Process data using get(), position(), etc.
 while (compositeBuffer.hasRemaining()) {
     byte b = compositeBuffer.get();
     // ... process byte ...
 }
 
 compositeBuffer.compact();      // Save unread bytes for next cycle
 return;                         // Wait for next receive()

    Internal State

    • The underflow buffer holds leftover bytes from previous cycles (always in read mode: position=0, limit=data length)
    • The data buffer is the external buffer passed to put() (its position/limit are captured but the buffer itself is not modified during reads)
    • The composite buffer maintains its own position/limit/mark independently, providing a unified view over both buffers

    Key Behaviors

    • put(data) - Adds data to view, leaves buffer in write mode (position at capacity)
    • flip() - Switches to read mode (position=0, limit=old position)
    • get() - Reads bytes, automatically handling transitions between underflow and data buffers
    • compact() - Moves unread bytes to underflow buffer, prepares for next put()
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CompositeByteBuffer()
      Creates a new composite byte buffer with a default minimum growth size of 256 bytes for the underflow buffer.
      CompositeByteBuffer​(int bufferMinGrowth)
      Creates a new composite byte buffer with the specified minimum growth size for the underflow buffer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CompositeByteBuffer

        public CompositeByteBuffer()
        Creates a new composite byte buffer with a default minimum growth size of 256 bytes for the underflow buffer.

      • CompositeByteBuffer

        public CompositeByteBuffer​(int bufferMinGrowth)
        Creates a new composite byte buffer with the specified minimum growth size for the underflow buffer.
        Parameters:
        bufferMinGrowth - the minimum size to allocate when growing the underflow buffer

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public CompositeByteBuffer put​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buf)
        Adds the data in the specified buffer to the view created by the composite buffer. This will be called at the start of the receive cycle. Further calls to this method without calling compact will overwrite previous data.

        After this call, the buffer is in write mode with position set to capacity (as if all the data has just been "written").

        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer to add
        Returns:
        this buffer for chaining

      • compact

        public CompositeByteBuffer compact()
        Compacts this buffer by moving unread bytes to the underflow buffer. This prepares the buffer for the next receive() cycle.

        The bytes between the buffer's current position and its limit, if any, are copied to the underflow buffer. The buffer's position is then set to the number of bytes copied (the underflow limit), the limit is set to the capacity, and the mark is discarded. The data buffer reference is cleared, ready for the next put() call.

        Returns:
        this buffer for chaining

      • position

        public int position()
        Returns the current position in the composite buffer.
        Returns:
        the position

      • limit

        public int limit()
        Returns the limit of the composite buffer.
        Returns:
        the limit

      • limit

        public CompositeByteBuffer limit​(int newLimit)
        Sets the limit of the composite buffer.
        Parameters:
        newLimit - the new limit position
        Returns:
        this buffer for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the new limit is invalid

      • capacity

        public int capacity()
        Returns the capacity of the composite buffer.
        Returns:
        the capacity

      • remaining

        public int remaining()
        Returns the number of remaining bytes in the composite buffer.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes between the current position and the limit

      • hasRemaining

        public boolean hasRemaining()
        Tells whether there are any remaining bytes to read.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, there is at least one byte remaining in this buffer

      • get

        public byte get()
        Relative get method. Reads the byte at this buffer's current position, and then increments the position.
        Returns:
        the byte at the current position
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferUnderflowException - if the buffer's current position is not smaller than its limit

      • get

        public byte get​(int index)
        Absolute get method. Reads the byte at the given index without modifying the current position.
        Parameters:
        index - the index from which the byte will be read
        Returns:
        the byte at the given index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or not smaller than the buffer's limit

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf​(byte b)
        Returns the virtual position of the first occurrence of the specified byte in this composite buffer, or -1 if the byte is not found.

        The search covers the unified view: first the underflow buffer from its position to its limit, then the data buffer from its position to its limit. The returned index is relative to the start of this unified view (i.e., position 0 of the underflow buffer).

        Parameters:
        b - the byte to search for
        Returns:
        the virtual index of the first occurrence of the byte, or -1 if not found

      • position

        public CompositeByteBuffer position​(int newPosition)
        Sets this buffer's position. If the mark is defined and larger than the new position then it is discarded.
        Parameters:
        newPosition - the new position value; must be non-negative and no larger than the current limit
        Returns:
        this buffer for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if newPosition is negative or larger than the current limit

      • mark

        public CompositeByteBuffer mark()
        Sets this buffer's mark at its current position.
        Returns:
        this buffer for chaining

      • reset

        public CompositeByteBuffer reset()
        Resets this buffer's position to the previously-marked position.
        Returns:
        this buffer for chaining
        Throws:
        java.nio.InvalidMarkException - if the mark has not been set

      • clear

        public CompositeByteBuffer clear()
        Clears this buffer. The position is set to zero, the limit is set to the capacity, and the mark is discarded.
        Returns:
        this buffer for chaining

      • flip

        public CompositeByteBuffer flip()
        Flips this buffer. The limit is set to the current position and then the position is set to zero. If the mark is defined then it is discarded.
        Returns:
        this buffer for chaining

      • rewind

        public CompositeByteBuffer rewind()
        Rewinds this buffer. The position is set to zero and the mark is discarded.
        Returns:
        this buffer for chaining

      • slice

        public CompositeByteBuffer slice()
        Creates a new composite byte buffer that shares this buffer's content. The two buffers' position, limit, and mark values will be independent. The new buffer's capacity, limit, and position will be identical to those of this buffer. The two buffers will share the same underlying data buffers.
        Returns:
        a new CompositeByteBuffer that shares content with this buffer

      • duplicate

        public CompositeByteBuffer duplicate()
        Creates a new composite byte buffer that shares this buffer's content. Identical to slice() except that the mark is also copied. The two buffers' position, limit, and mark values will be independent, but they will share the same underlying data buffers.
        Returns:
        a new CompositeByteBuffer that shares content with this buffer

      • hasArray

        public boolean hasArray()
        Tells whether or not this buffer is backed by an accessible byte array. Always returns false for CompositeByteBuffer since it's backed by multiple buffers.
        Returns:
        false

      • array

        public byte[] array()
        Returns the byte array that backs this buffer (optional operation). This method is not supported for CompositeByteBuffer.
        Returns:
        (never returns)
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - always

      • arrayOffset

        public int arrayOffset()
        Returns the offset within this buffer's backing array of the first element of the buffer (optional operation). This method is not supported for CompositeByteBuffer.
        Returns:
        (never returns)
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - always

      • get

        public CompositeByteBuffer get​(byte[] dst,
                               int offset,
                               int length)
        Relative bulk get method. Copies bytes from this buffer into the destination array. This method uses efficient bulk transfer operations on the underlying buffers.
        Parameters:
        dst - the destination byte array
        offset - the offset in the destination array to start writing
        length - the number of bytes to copy
        Returns:
        this buffer for chaining
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferUnderflowException - if there are fewer than length bytes remaining in this buffer
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the preconditions on the offset and length parameters do not hold

      • get

        public CompositeByteBuffer get​(byte[] dst)
        Relative bulk get method. Copies bytes from this buffer into the destination array. This method is equivalent to get(dst, 0, dst.length).
        Parameters:
        dst - the destination byte array
        Returns:
        this buffer for chaining
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferUnderflowException - if there are fewer than dst.length bytes remaining in this buffer

      • decode

        public java.nio.charset.CoderResult decode​(java.nio.charset.CharsetDecoder decoder,
                                           java.nio.CharBuffer out,
                                           boolean endOfInput)
        Decodes bytes from this composite buffer into the given character buffer using the given charset decoder. This method handles the complexity of decoding across the underflow/data buffer boundary.

        If decoding from the underflow buffer results in UNDERFLOW and there is still data in the data buffer, this method will compact the buffers (merging remaining bytes) and retry the decode operation. This handles the case where a multi-byte character spans the boundary between the two buffers.

        The composite buffer's position is updated to reflect the number of bytes consumed during decoding.

        Parameters:
        decoder - the charset decoder to use
        out - the character buffer to decode into
        endOfInput - true if this is the last chunk of input
        Returns:
        a CoderResult describing the result of the decode operation
